Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: This is my Fredricksburg house and my grandma Ruth playing with my skateboard ramp. It's a Tony Hawk jump ramp.

Speaker: mick
Dialogue: I forgot what I was going to say.

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: This is me at my second birthday party with my mom and my dad. That's my cake.

Speaker: mick
Dialogue: Where's your gun?

Speaker: little boy
Dialogue: Yeah, where is your gun?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'm assuming that there are no bad guys in this room. Isn't that right? I mean, are you guys good guys or bad guys?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Right. So why would I have brought my gun to a room full of good guys?

Speaker: miss ross
Dialogue: What's that picture?

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: This is me and my dad playing Battleship at my dad's apartment.

Speaker: mick
Dialogue: What is a battleship?

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: My parents are divorced.

Speaker: miss ross
Dialogue: So, who's that in that picture up on top?

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: That's my fish, his name is Jaws and he's a really mean fish.

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: My mommy is a Think Tank worker and she is really, really smart. She went to two colleges and has three computers.

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: This is the day that my daddy says is the happiest day of his life.

Speaker: miss ross
Dialogue: Really. His happiest day! Can you tell us about that day, Mr. Fleury?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I sure can. That was December 4th and that was the day that we spent the whole day in the hospital waiting for this guy right here to come out of Kevin's mom's tummy. And we waited and waited but he wouldn't come and we kept waiting and finally the doctor said `OK...he's not gonna come out on his own so we got to go get him.' And well,

Speaker: miss ross
Dialogue: Go for it.

Speaker: miss ross
Dialogue: Then what happened?

Speaker: lu lu
Dialogue: What did they do?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: They started to pull and pull and pull... they had something in there and it started coming and they were pulling and the doctor all of the sudden said "STOP!"

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: How are you today, Sergeant?

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: Sun is shining. Wind is blowing. How bad can I be doing?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: I like that, "Sun is shining..."

Speaker: white man
Dialogue: GET DIRTY!

Speaker: pitcher
Dialogue: STEP IT UP NOW!  Ready for my knuckle-curve?

Speaker: teammates
Dialogue: TAG UP! WAIT `TIL SHE CATCHES IT-

Speaker: pitcher
Dialogue: -COMIN' HOME!

Speaker: grandfather
Dialogue: Don't stop watching the game.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: You have a copy of the duty rost-

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: LOCK DOWN!

Speaker: watching officer
Dialogue: COME TO ME! FOLLOW ME!

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Fran?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Hey, I'm at Kevin's school. What's goin' on?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Where exactly?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: Dad?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: When?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Fran, I'm rollin' right now. Let me call you back: I gotta ring bells

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Son, I gotta go to work.

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: We're gonna do ceramics...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I gotta go to work...

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: Who was that?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Big Fran -- you remember him?

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: Uncle Fran? Put peanuts in his Coke so he could drink and eat all at the same time?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Where he's from in South Carolina that's called fine-dining, Bud.

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Something bad.

Speaker: kevin
Dialogue: `Lotta bad people out there...'

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: kevin fleury
Dialogue: You gonna go see him?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm gonna try...

Speaker: miss ross
Dialogue: Where's your husband going?

Speaker: lyla fleury
Dialogue: Ex-husband, and God knows.

Speaker: francis manner
Dialogue: Rex, how old were you when your hat was that small?

Speaker: rex burr
Dialogue: You gotta stand, Big Man.

Speaker: francis manner
Dialogue: We need to get everyone back, then get all their-

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: It was... I don't know what time it was... the dishwasher's broken...I was waiting for the dishwasher... The doorbell rang - I thought it was... it wasn't the dishwasher guy...It wasn't. It wasn't.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Glenda, I want you to look at me.

Speaker: cnn reporter
Dialogue: ...1 hour ago: blasts in Saudi Arabia, in or around the `Al- Rahmah' western housing complex near Riyadh. More than 100 feared dead, including children. The Saudi Foreign Minister has released a statement calling this a `heinous act possibly committed by foreigners...'

Speaker: bbc reporter
Dialogue: ...homes to thousands of Westerners and other non-Saudis who work in the Kingdom, there have been several attacks on these compounds in the last five years. As such, they have become very tight in terms of security, with both the Saudi National Guard and police taking command.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Numbers so far: 100+ dead, 200+ injured. The target was a softball game. Rumor is the Killers wore Saudi police uniforms.  Special Agent Fran Manner was killed.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: From the craters, looks like they used a High Explosive... possibly military grade: can't fit that much TNT into a vest. 20, 30 pounds of PETN: they got it. Semtex or C-4: they could get it. The third there, God knows...that crater looks like a plane dropped a 500-pounder...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Obviously a secondary blast after the initial devices used to lure first responders to the scene. Don't know anything about where or what it was yet.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: This is how they do it.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: If you already know the answer Adam, why ask the question?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: We're not seeing this kind of planning and execution anywhere else...these ain't hot-wired artillery shells waiting for Humvees to roll by.  These hits are coordinated: planning, timing, and big, broad- daylight balls-

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Yeah, So... did they all happen during daylight?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: We had two others...North of Riyadh and the oil thing. What was that?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: The Refinery... Ras Tenura Refinery.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Yeah, south of Jeddah. Same thing: daylight, suicide bombers. Right?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Yup.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: This is not new in concept. It is new in scope. It's bigger. Very sophisticated. Command and control was flawless. They found the largest kill zone they could and they did it... they did it by being patient.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Any rumors or confirmations of uniforms being used in the other two attacks?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: That's `worst case scenario' if you're still asking for my stab, Sir. A crew who can build bombs this big, with this level of eyes- on control and detonation coordination... has access to Saudi uniforms now...I mean...Baby Jesus.

Speaker: leavitt
Dialogue: Anyone take credit?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Abu Hamza. Saudi Al-Qaeda. Bin- Laden-wanna-be. We know he was in Afghanistan, then moved to Iraq. Now he seems to have come home. He's clearly becoming increasingly active...

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: If it is Hamza, he's definitely turning up the volume over there.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: They can't afford to appear as if they are losing any kind of control. They lose control over their country, their people...then they risk losing control over the oil. They won't let us in. No way.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: From the State Department, one hour ago: `We are in agreement with the Saudi security assessment that any additional American presence on Kingdom soil represents reckless risk. Therefore it is the Secretary of State's position that only after the situation has been evaluated and contained, should the Federal Bureau of Investigation activate Rapid Deployment.'  I'm going to get us access. Keep your go bags hot. It's gonna come fast.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: How's he gonna do that?

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: Killing those I saw responsible.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: I don't understand.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: -that is not a crime-

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: It's not.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: I do not.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: I am not my brother.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: I am NOT my brother!

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: Uniforms?

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: I sweat. I'll say it again because it is true. I need more uniforms because I must change during shifts...look at my shirts.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: -then look at my jackets. Please. Permanent stains...no matter how many times they're cleaned...

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: I love my country.

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: I love my country...

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: Everyone's terrified, so nothing moves. Paralysis. You and your team aren't going anywhere.  And this meeting is just a circle- jerk, Ronnie: Attorney General Young's going to go through the motions because protocol says we get an appeal. We'll be on record, but expect nothing more.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yeah, sure. No problem.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: What about Agent Mayes?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Ask her.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: What about you?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: I'll be fine.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: I apologize if we're late-

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: They were early.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: You know Special Agent Fleury?

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: This is agent Janet Mayes, she's one of our Arabic experts.

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: OK. The latest.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Two suicide bombers. Rumors they were dressed as Saudi Police. We believe this is the work of Saudi terrorist named Abu Hamza.

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: A Shooter crew served as distraction. After the initial attack there was a lull to allow Saudi Emergency Teams...and our own attaches...to collect. Then a secondary blast was triggered, aimed at those first responders. So they targeted families and rescuers with one attack.  I think that's a clear signal that their definition of `Enemy' is expanding.

Speaker: maricella canavesio
Dialogue: My God.

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: Let us never forget how cheap life is over there. Now...I have seven minutes before my next meeting, so who's talking first?  You two digested the memo?

Speaker: ellis leach
Dialogue: I'll go first if that's okay Maricella?  First, I'm sorry about Fran Manner.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: As we are about Rex Burr.

Speaker: ellis leach
Dialogue: I met with Prince Thamer at the Saudi embassy fifteen minutes after I heard this morning's news. After speaking with Thamer, I advised we withhold additional US personnel because a big part of the religious justification for these bombs is the presence of current US personnel. More boots on Saudi soil make an already combustible situation more so. I know that's not the answer you want, but...

Speaker: maricella canavesio
Dialogue: My two cents: The Saudis haven't asked for FBI help. Sounds like they've done just the opposite. If we force the issue, that could further anger an utterly important ally that shares a 1000-mile long border with Iraq.

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: It's all rock-solid logic.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: We would just like to be on record as saying we think we should go ASAP-

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: That's not going to happen

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Sir, how would you imagine it looks viewed through an FBI agents eyes?

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: Pardon me?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm interested in how you think this situation is viewed through our eyes.

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: It's some variation on vengeance... When one of your own is killed, Agents lose their analytical powers - kind of a greatest strength, greatest weakness thing...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: If I wanted vengeance, I'd have whispered `Rex Burr' into Ellis's ear right when we walked in.

Speaker: maricella canavesio
Dialogue: What's the distinction?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: To call this massacre an act of terrorism... that implies a specific political agenda. To me, these killings are so futile and unbalanced that they feel utterly sociopathic- more like Charles Manson than Osama Bin Laden...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Al Qaeda lost the first phase of this war, so a new, zero-sum phase has begun: if you won't join us, we'll let loose the truly talented Murderers... Abu Hamza. He will kill so many of you that the resulting humiliation of the Saudi Royal Family will cause an exodus, a rebellion, both. Because the Royal Family simply cannot protect you or yours any longer.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: When she says talented, she's not talking about the walking-bombs who can sneak past any and all security, nor the hi-jackers tough enough to take an airliner. We're talking about the Man who teaches them how...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: --the operational commander who organizes, trains, plans, encourages. That is who we're fighting.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: If we don't get inside Saudi Arabia within 36 hours, there is no chance we catch the killer responsible for Al-Rahmah. None.

Speaker: ellis leach
Dialogue: Okay. I believe it all. So doesn't your team in that country represent the kind of target one of these `Masters' would die for? Trade ten of their own for one of you?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: To not engage these criminals out of fear for our personal safety is just another way of saying `uncle.'

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: That was spirited... let's all thank God Special Agent Fleury doesn't make policy decisions. He'd turn the FBI into Patton's Third Army.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: I see the look in your eyes. That look is trouble: old school, play ground shit, vengeance...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: It's not vengeance.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: It ain't justice. It's stronger. We've all been there. I have. Vengeance is always dirty, Ronnie.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I just can't sit this out. I can't watch this not get dealt with. Not again.  Know what my high school football coach used to say to me?

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: "HIT SOMETHING." All night long, Coach Bailey would scream "HIT SOMETHING." Every play.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: That's good coaching.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm fixing to go hit something, boss. You with me?

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: How you gonna do it?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: The Saudis covet good PR as much as their Oil: 15 of 19 hijackers on 9- 11 means most Americans will never stop asking if that Saudi Oil is worth it. It's all about press.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: Few more moves and it's Total War, Ronnie. The only time Treason is palatable is when it's done righteously and completely...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Oh, I'm in...Not a question. I'm definitely going.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What's your take?

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: Looks like every overthrow in history: once the guys with the guns are no longer trustworthy, the government's days are numbered.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: White House call you with a spin?

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: You kidding? We don't talk since I broke the Vice President's guy cooking dirty intel on Iran. They hate me. What's up, Fleury?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: How hard you gonna hit the Royal Family in your column tomorrow?

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: With a sledgehammer.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: With the bombings? Or other things...

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: What's "other" than the bombings?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I know you're tracking Al Haramain.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: Is that what you want to talk about? Saudi officials making donations that end up... What? Blowing up trains in Paris? Buses in London?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Sometimes. Seems that just might happen.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: Murder...Hookers...Houston? Can I take some notes?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm not saying that.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: Are you saying anything?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I need a favor.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: I don't do favors, Ronnie.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: When it's real and it will be real... I'll come to you with what we have first. It's yours. Exclusive.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You call Thamer at the Embassy. Tell him that the FBI is getting real close to laying out some major Saudi VIP indictments relating to newly uncovered charity financing out of a Boston investment firm. We're gonna freeze a lot of Saudi cash and roll out some major embarrassment.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: Can I mention Houston?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: It's a free world, baby. Ask him to comment.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: He won't.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Tell him that I'm running the investigation.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Tell him that I'm not the nicest kid on the block.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: That would be accurate.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I want fifteen minutes with him tonight.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: Wow. OK. And I get what?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I come to you first. No one else.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: What's really going on here, Ronnie? You going strong over Fran Manner?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm just trying to do my job, Elaine. That's it. Call Thamer.

Speaker: elaine flowers
Dialogue: I'll see what I can do.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Get back in.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Too many people we both know were at the bar. It's a pleasure to meet you, Your Highness.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: I had an interesting conversation with a reporter from the Post.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: She can be a bit of an exaggerator... I'm sure things were somewhat over-stated. I see myself as friend of Saudi Arabia. I just need a little cooperation, that's all.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: What kind of cooperation??

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Full cooperation: my Team cleared to land at Prince Sultan Air Base. Tomorrow. We want to help in a very muscular way, quickly.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: Next month would be as soon as...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: This goes one of two ways. First: The FBI with the White House go on the kind of aggressive PR "Saudi Royal Family Decaying Monarchy" bender that just can't help but hurt. Really hurt. And I don't care how many Chinese are lined up to buy the oil. You know it's gonna hurt.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: My family is not decaying-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: And then we bring the hammer down hard as hell: Bust Al Haramain - we got direct links from Riyadh - two wives donating ten million to three Arab-American cultural centers in Boston. Then what gets kind of not- funny is how some of that cash found its way to Jakarta and some Mosques that have these training camps built right next to them. It's kinda funny... you got little kids playing over here, and some not so little kids playing with guns over here. That's kinda odd.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: You have no proof of this.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: We're getting there, Sir. And I haven't even brought up the two girls still missing out of Houston. This is big. It is real. And I know you only care so much about public American opinion, Sir. But the story will be covered... Big...

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: What is your point?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Last I heard, 112 people lost their lives in your country. One of them was a good friend of mine. I want in and I want in immediately.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: Define "immediately."

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Right now immediately.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: If your phone doesn't work international, you can borrow mine.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: We cannot allow 100 agents-

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: -even 25 more armed Americans could spark rebellion-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: That's too bad.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: Saudi Security. That's non negotiable. You cannot bring guns into the Kingdom.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Men in Saudi Police uniforms are why we're talking now.

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: They would be hand picked.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Whose hands?

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: Mine.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: If anything happens to me or my team... It's on you. Understood?

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: Cool it with the John Wayne, Mr. Fleury.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: -seven-day or work-week?

Speaker: prince thamer
Dialogue: Work week. Five days. No guns.

Speaker: haytham's father
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: You haven't heard about the attack?

Speaker: haytham's father
Dialogue: I choose not to listen anymore. What happened to your face?

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: An attack today.

Speaker: haytham's father
Dialogue: Look at me.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: What was Fran Manner to her?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: He taught her how to shoot, she taught him most everything else.  Celebrated graduation at the IHOP in-town until some Townie called Janet something...Something not very nice. Townie didn't see Fran coming outta the Head. But he definitely felt Fran's uppercut shatter his jaw.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Fran didn't get bounced for that?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: SAC Fleury took care of him.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: If I knew how I'd be SAC Sykes. I do know the post in Riyadh was part of the deal Fleury cut to save Fran's career.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: What did SAC Fleury whisper in your ear this morning?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: `Grant's age is a liability.'

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: What can four people do in five days? Really?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Aren't you the one who demanded to go this morning?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: I meant the FBI. I didn't mean "me."

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Mars.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: I'll be looked at with what I can only describe as disdain, pretty much the entire time we're on the ground... kind of like South Virginia.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Go easy on my kin.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: It's a very confused culture. Extremely religious. Had nothing; wanted nothing. Sixty years ago, they hit oil. Simple religious men become trillionaires... a schizophrenic nation is born. The royal family, who we back, and everyone else.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: What's going on in there?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm good.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Feels like you got a beast in there, Fleury.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm good

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: "Good" is 6:00 am Sunday morning when your kid climbs into your bed, buries himself into you... sun's creeping through the windows - soft. Birds and wind-chimes... that's "good."

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm OK...You don't think I'm OK?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: I think you're not entirely clear right now. That's OK, but you got to know that. You want to go - we go. I got you, but you got to check yourself.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm checked.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: OK. I'm just checking that you checked.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: How we doing?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: They gonna let us land?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Hunting...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Big Game hunting.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Heads on a swivel.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Special Agent Ronald Fleury.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: We brought our own.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Israeli stamp in my passport?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: And I usually just toss it on the kitchen table...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Wouldn't need the power a' prayer if there were 2 hands on the wheel.

Speaker: adam leaviit
Dialogue: 110 miles per hour... How do you keep so calm? I mean, really? Is it breathing--

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: --Shhhh....

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: If somebody was tailing us it'd be obvious. This is just standard operating speed.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You don't know what you missed... you should have seen him play for our Chicago Bulls.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: You have portable lights on-scene?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: We only have seven days: we work around the clock.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: We're safe during the day?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: I don't like camels.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: You interviewed witnesses?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Were any of the uniformed bombers brother-officers?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You don't know the source of the blast, don't know if your own Officers were involved, but you won't let us work nights?

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: Good afternoon, Sir.

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: `Sunlight is indeed the most powerful disinfectant.

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: Senators? Then I'd change `outmoded' to `outdated,' `echelons' to `ranks' and what in God's name is `contretemps?' These guys aren't the best and brightest-

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: -never take the Lord's name in vain in this office-

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: -but you can say `Fucking?'

Speaker: gideon young
Dialogue: -you really want to bet?

Speaker: director grace
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: That's one of the great horrors of television: Crime scene manipulation. They say a TV camera adds pounds to actresses. Isn't that what they say?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Who's "they?"

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: That is what they say. Doesn't add to crime scenes. Television cameras shrink them. Misrepresent. No smells. Poor sound. Limited view. TV always makes them look smaller. You can't feel the hatred on television.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: ...heads on a swivel, people.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: EASY.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: What time tomorrow morning?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What time is sunrise?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: That's against fire code.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: They don't have fire codes. They don't have codes other than codes of war. They'll lock us in and dial up some kind of earth movers if they want to. You know that, Sykes. Dig a big hole and push us in. Fill it up and no one comes calling. You're in the jungle now, baby.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: You alright, girl?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Watch it, boy.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Just asking...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Unpack.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Saudi slow roll...

Speaker: lyla fleury
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Hey... How are you? How's my boy?

Speaker: lyla fleury
Dialogue: We're just fine. How are you? Where are you?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm here...  Lemme talk to my boy.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: What you doing?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'm missing you.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'm in Saudi Arabia.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Yeah... I saw him...  I saw him.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Yeah... Yeah...he's still tall.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Yeah, buddy. I love you. Keep your eye on your mama. Be the man.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'll call you tomorrow. I love you.

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: You are in so much trouble.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: For sure. I mean, I don't know how you did it. Nice work, but if you live through this, which I put at about fifty percent - if you do, your balls are gonna get stretched and beaten on. Dig that?

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: Nice pictures. You guys ready to go home now?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Slow roll... gonna be like when you go deep sea fishing in Florida and you pay seven hundred bucks for the boat and you sit in the ocean for hours and the crew jumps around and screams and points and you think your constantly about to bag a Marlin but you never do and they keep pointing and jumping and-

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Enough.

Speaker: police officer
Dialogue: You're willing to die to protect your enemy?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What did the Prince say?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What rules?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: That's not accurate--

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: How could they get more secure?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Well, this is going well...

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Saudi Slow Roll.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: leavitt
Dialogue: How do you do that?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Check.

Speaker: leavitt
Dialogue: Don't say `good' again.

Speaker: janet
Dialogue: Bueno.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Of course we won't.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I would have thought your primary concern was investigating a crime.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Is it one of those kind of deals, Colonel?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: So, if you're not running the investigation...who is?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: I thought the SANG were soldiers--

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Who is in charge of the investigation then?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: To walk through? Are you kidding me?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Get him over here now and let's clarify this situation.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: There sure as hell is! I don't know what kind of game you're playing but you got the wrong guy, Colonel Al-Ghazi! That was not the deal-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'm guessing there are a bunch of Americans, Brits... Australians? Someone must have seen something. I'm sure they're just dying to talk to you guys, seeing as how the killers were wearing your uniforms. That must be a real confidence booster for them.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: There's still a couple of hundred of us living on the compound.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Why Saudi Arabia?

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Neither of us did anymore schooling than Electra High, Electra Texas.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: And the jobs here pay twice what you'd make in Midland or the Gulf a' Mexico. Plus the house is free.

Speaker: janine ripon
Dialogue: I call it combat pay. This place has gone Guns - Guns - Guns.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: So has Everyone else now.

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: My girlfriends in Texas spend their combat pay on diamonds... I spent mine on a safe room.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Two nights back. Can you start one second before you knew anything was wrong?

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: We didn't really see anything. Just hit the ground and hustled to the safe room. Closed our eyes and prayed. It was so fast. So loud.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: So you really didn't see anything.

Speaker: maddy
Dialogue: I hit the deck. Horrible.

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: Not `til after. Just the screams--

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: -- the kids... they were screaming. That got me out of the house. Those kids.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Which kids were those?

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: The Jackson kids. Tracy Jackson next door was murdered looking out her window...front of her children. No safe room over there...  Not even the Men that did this should die in front a' their babies.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: She live with her husband?

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Aaron.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: If I'm facing your house, is the Jackson home to the right or left?

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: Left.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Mr. Aaron Jackson?

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: Get him away from me-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: -easy, Sir. He's a friend to us-

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: -I don't know either one a' you.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I'm Special Agent Ronald Fleury of the FBI. This is Colonel Al-Ghazi with the Saudi State Police-

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: -the Police: they attacked.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Can I come back?

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: WHY?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Your boys...

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: When my wife's jaw was shot off in front of our sons? My sons who sat with her while she bled to death? Couldn't speak because she didn't have the bottom of her face and I wasn't home and my baby boys are destroyed for life and my five year- old had a box of band-aids in his hand when I finally got home?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: ...I won't pretend to know...

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: Kill everyone that had something to do with this. Everyone related to them. Everyone who knew them.  And all you'd be doing is their recruiting for them... It's an entire generation: not small and isolated like they say. But a generation that thinks what they did to my wife, to my children, is a "calling"...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Up the street, there was a wreck, did you see any-

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: -notice how it wouldn't take a lot to disguise your friend  as a Mexican? Think he couldn't handle crossing our deserts? Look around!

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Aaron-

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: -LET ME FINISH GOD DAMN YOU-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Can we tour the compound? Can we please do that?  Slow nod from Al-Ghazi.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: He or she almost made it.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: That's what makes this a War.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Hit a water main?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Hole is the case. See, there's "evidence" down in that hole. You understand evidence? Little things that are "clues." Clues can be very helpful to a fella when he's trying to solve a crime.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Glad to hear it. So can we get in there?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: A little high...

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Watt-tee...

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Watt-tee fuck  is his gun doing up so high?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Are the Shooters in-custody-

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: -dead.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Were any of these shooters your men?

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: They got into the compound. Somehow...took control of this vehicle. I'm guessing they didn't politely ask whoever was in this car if they could take it for a little ride?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I understand that. Those men were your men--

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: -- they were. They were Police.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Good news is that if he shoots you, he's gonna shoot you sitting on an American tank... with an American- made bullet. So, it's kind of "all in the family."

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: How about we get into those American Suburbans... with their American A/C...  Al-Ghazi continues the tour as Fleury once again notes the familiar apartment off in the distance.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: The car was parked here?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Backed in?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: They were attacked from the front. Must have assumed the killers were fellow officers... Have any of these men been identified?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: The same Mosque is enough to identify them, link them to a cell?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Suweidi?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Suweidi is a known militant stonghold. Al-Qaeda could recruit from storefronts.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Can we go to check out some of these surrounding buildings?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Seems reasonable that the Planner had to observe and based on Hamza's past history, it's consistent that he would want to video the attack. Is that true? Is that accurate?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Well, in order to video, in order to observe, you need a view.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: That building sees all three crime scenes.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: -c'mon now. This is insane: we got enough security to invade Suweidi, let alone that building-

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: -time. I understand.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: This is the kind of radical circumstance that could have seriously upped Shaq's free throw percentages. Take a man. Ship him off to Riyadh. No phones, constant threat of death, no girls, no hip hop. Nothing... just free throws. Shaq, he'd be shooting at least seventy percent. Lakers would still be together. Kobe and Shaq lovers forever.

Speaker: sang officer
Dialogue: This is unacceptable.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Tell me it didn't burst-tell me it didn't burst-

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I see.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Two big answers in two small minutes. Imagine if we had a couple days together.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: And I imagine that will run until sundown?

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: You want to tell her that?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Big wall.

Dialogue: How many Princes are there?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: They all get palaces this big?

Dialogue: Who pays for all this?

Dialogue: General Motors, Ford, Chevrolet...

Dialogue: Hey, man - I drive a Hybrid.

Dialogue: What's a Raptor?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Super.

Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I've seen that the man who planned the worst crime in your Kingdom's history is without a doubt Saudi...

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: That was impressive.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Think it will work?

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Yeah. Maybe. I mean, you can only play the "I'm going to the press card" like three more times. So, maybe.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: They're paranoid and overly self- protective.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: They aren't protecting anyone. There's no conspiracy. They're just terrified. Finally. The Saudis have finally seen the Monsters they helped create, because those Monsters have come home. And if Saudis don't catch Saudi Monsters, that's the end.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: That's dead on accurate. Very impressive. That's why they're making it hard on us, and that's why he wants to help `em turn the screws.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: They can have every shred of credit-

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: -you see the slums on the way in?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: See that even though their homes are falling down, they had satellite dishes bolted on?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: Everyone already knows you're here. Credit? If the Saudis cracked this Cell while these servants were pouring coffee, Al-Jazeera still leads the story with your Team.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Have you been to the crime-scene?

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: No-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: -if you had, you'd see the evil work of real Talent. The kind that doesn't stop until it's forced.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: And the path to Hell is paved with good intentions.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You having fun?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: By catching Abu Hamza.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: Then here's to you. Let's bet: when this Colonel Al-Ghazi comes out, he's in-charge of the investigation -if so, you set me up on a date with Janet Mayes.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Do me a   favor and tell Janet that she and   Damon Schmidt got a date when he   gets back to the States.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: We should start with the dead shooters.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Can we photograph all three of them? Couple hundred copies each...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Good. If it's OK with you, I'd like to suggest we split up as follows...

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Got to get a little dirty, people. Crawl up in it. Make deep contact. You get that?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Have him pass these out to the compound security. See if anybody knows them.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Would you mind doing one more thing for me?

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: No, Sir.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Could you tell me if you recognize any of these men?

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: ...Horrible.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: I don't know any of them.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: I'm just wondering. That chair out side. Looks like it gets a lot of wear. Looks comfortable.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: That my mom's chair.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: See, that's exactly what I was thinking. I'm guessing she spends a lot of time sitting outside?

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: All day.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: She must pretty much see it all. Right?

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: She does.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: She's sleeping.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Let's wake her up.

Dialogue: I've seen him.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: maddy
Dialogue: Like, a week ago. Twice I've seen him. Watering...With the garden crews. I remember he was wearing a Liza Minnelli T-shirt. I thought that was funny.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What about the others?

Speaker: maddy
Dialogue: No. Just him. I remember the T- shirt. I remember thinking it was odd...?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What, the Liza Minelli shirt?

Speaker: maddy
Dialogue: No. I do think Liza Minelli's gone odd, but that wasn't it.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What was odd?

Speaker: maddy
Dialogue: He was a Saudi. The gardener.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: maddy
Dialogue: Saudis, like Americans, don't do manual labor. Blowing leaves is beneath them.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Who is he?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: That's one of the many things we're trying to find out...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: How are your Sons?

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: -what do you know about what my kids need? What they saw? What the rest of their lives might be like?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: I thought maybe your Boys...without their Mom anymore...might ask you why sometime...

Speaker: aaron jackson
Dialogue: Tomorrow it'll be somebody else's wife.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Then tomorrow I'll come back.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: We know where he lives?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You don't seem very excited.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: It's a gurney.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: You cannot touch any Muslims.

Speaker: janet
Dialogue: No problem. Can I still touch Americans?

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: What's gas running a gallon out here, Al-Ghazi? Penny gallon?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: A trillion reasons for our Leaders to hold hands another one hundred years.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Agreed.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yes, I do.

Speaker: fleury
Dialogue: Feel like I'm back home in Detroit.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: OK. Shouldn't we arrest him or shoot him or something?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: This place is community service?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Why did he turn himself in?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: How does he know he slept soundly?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Is that why you quit?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Well, I think I get the `prayer' and `luck' parts...

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Whatever this is, it blasted-off like NASA.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: Driven in at an angle... go deeper...

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: `High-order explosion' doesn't do it justice: what's left a' this looks like it was put through a wood-chipper.

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: Hospital Identification... Ambulance identification.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Do you know this hospital?

Speaker: sergeant haytham
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Call it in.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What you got?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Where's Muaath?  COLONEL AL-GHAZI I'm going to show you.

Dialogue: We never get to do anything fun.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Sykes, I'm guessing you don't even remember how to load your gun.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: That's not funny.

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: She's not trying to be funny.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: I'm a very good shot.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: I'm sure.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Prints are on the other side...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: JANET...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Yeah... I pulled so much it's hard to remember it all.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Bolts?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Wing nuts?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Razor blades?

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: ADAM...

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: The Coalition...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: -the Prince's Convoy just showed.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: This is bullshit. You know it. Meaningless. There's no leader here. These are kids. That's it.

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: We're out of here.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yes, that's it. Smile for the cameras, body-bag some children. Wrap it up, but us -- out. I get it.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You need water?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: You really ought not look at this.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: That fella got shot right through his God damn nipple...

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Don't stare too long. It'll start living in your dreams.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: No -- I know.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You do?  How did you know we were here?

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: The Prince has Men at Al-Rahmah.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: Ask him.  3 vehicles will stay behind when the Prince and Press leave. You'll convoy straight to BA flights into Dulles -- last minute fares come out of your budget, by-the-by. Tried to swing upgrades, but check at the counter.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: -Ellis Leach?

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: You know him? He's gonna be put out to pasture: made an example of by the President to ensure all levels of government get tough on Terror.  You won the hand on the River card.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: We didn't win shit, Schmidt. These are teenagers... children with pictures that someone far senior has provided them.

Speaker: damon schmidt
Dialogue: -kidding me? You mean those are Terrorist targets? Holy Wow. Momma, don't let your children grow up to be cowboys.  Just get ready to go home and revel in the fact that for the next few weeks your shit won't stink.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: I'm thinking about going straight to Dan's, gonna order six PBRs-

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: -Pabst?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Keep it real. You ever drink PBR, Haytham?

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Any beer?

Speaker: haytham
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: Now...that's just unreasonable. Good Police work and problem drinking are like a chicken and egg thing: which enables the other?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Remember how we caught that cell?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Four hundred dollars. For four hundred dollars, he was caught. Stupidity. Catching the cell was easy. Just like this. The cell came back.

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: I'm serious. Beer will open up your subconscious. Canned beer especially. Give you instincts they can't teach-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: Is he responding to the call? Dropped back...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: You whole?

Speaker: adam leavitt
Dialogue: Think so-

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: WHAT THE-

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: ADAM! WHAT -- WHAT ARE THEY DOING?

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: GUN!

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: -DOOR HELP-

Dialogue: Hands up -- you're gonna fall-

Dialogue: They're going to disappear...

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: GET DOWN!

Dialogue: Nobody's gonna hurt Leavitt but me.

Speaker: the son
Dialogue: DO NOT COME HERE!

Dialogue: He's been shot! BE READY.

Speaker: passport officer
Dialogue: NOW. HURRY.

Speaker: ronald fleury
Dialogue: BRAKES-REVERSE-TO THE RIGHT...

Speaker: grant sykes
Dialogue: -GET OUT OF-

Dialogue: MOB FORMING NEXT BLOCK!

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: READY?

Dialogue: RPG!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: THIRTY EIGHT RAZOR MAD DOG!!!

Dialogue: ADAM?!

Speaker: janet mayes
Dialogue: Sykes is going to kick your ass.

Dialogue: Everybody OK?

Dialogue: There's at least three more of them.

Dialogue: It's okay Little One.

Dialogue: You are a traitor to your country... a traitor to your God.

Speaker: aunt
Dialogue: Will you tell me what Grandfather whispered to you before they took him?

Speaker: grandson
Dialogue: "Don't worry: we'll kill them all."

Dialogue: You stop the people that hurt Uncle Fran?
